bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 22, 1899

div1.p: Lazear provides family news and inquires when to expect Sweitzer.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 22, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Oct 22 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I was glad to get your
letter on Friday. I think it will
be very nice for you to go to Bryan
Mourr. I have no doubt you will
enjoy your stay there. We were out
at Windsor this afternoon. Aunt Kate
is looking much better. Her knee
still gives her trouble but I think it
will gradually wear away. She seems
much more cheerful.

It is certainly nice for you and
Mrs. McCallam to be seeing so much
Remember me to her if she is
still with you. There is no place
like New York for having a good time.

Be sure to let me know when to
expect you. Mabel sends love
